key_risks: Market sensitivity to economic downturns, rising interest rates, and geopolitical instability
Intense competition from global players like CBRE, JLL, and Cushman & Wakefield
Regulatory and legal risks due to changes in real estate regulations, tax policies, or zoning laws
Cybersecurity threats from increased reliance on technology
Leadership and governance concerns due to ongoing litigation and executive nominations
controversies: Litigation over $200 million in bonuses and buybacks related to the 2013 sale of eSpeed to Nasdaq
Nomination of Executive Chairman Howard Lutnick for U.S. Secretary of Commerce
social_issues: Employee concerns about workplace stress and management, with only 62% recommending the company
governance_issues: Questions about governance practices due to litigation over executive compensation
Potential reputational and operational risks from leadership controversies
